lexUnit.name: dip.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: sink, drop, or slope downwards

sentence.text: The vessel dipped above the surface of the river and Rostov judged that it was hovering roughly over the spot where the escape pod had disappeared .
The sun was already dipping behind the evening clouds and the colours and fun had disappeared .
A silver-washed fritillary butterfly dipped between the tufts of grass to find the violet leaves on which she lays her eggs .
Above us the fronds of the palm trees clattered in the warm wind , while out to sea Bonefish 's ragged and patched sail dipped in the steep waves beyond the reef .
The October sun dipped into the Atlantic , silhouetting the Paps of Jura as we shoved off into the sound toward Harry 's Island .
Sometimes as they fly , they tilt their bodies so that their tails dip into the water , and beat a further few strokes , renewing their impetus and extending their flight .
A flock of goldfinches fluttered and dipped through a patch of tall , seeding thistles , making the sweet , plaintive call that the Saxons call ` chirm " , or ` charm " .
The plane slewed sharply , dipping towards the runway .
Jon Gittens ' over-hit back pass was dipping under the bar until quick-thinking Pears turned it over with a neatly executed back header .
He felt the bed dip slightly under her weight , and he knew she was kneeling beside him .
The moon dipped out of a cloud , and Jed shuddered .
The interested reader is invited to dip into " Organisation and Management of a Solicitor 's Practice " ( Longman , 1980 , updated to 1991 ) for guidance in these respects .
She watched when the sun dipped away and let darkness come with its moon riding high and silver .
The plane dipped down and its starboard wing hit the water , flinging off Mr Treweek .
The next morning Carolyn stayed in her room and read , dipping in and out of Clare 's books and staring out of the window , feeling surprisingly content .
You dip down the drive from the Yoxford to Peasenhall road across an ornamental bridge and on towards this plain and golden Greek Revival house .
I dipped down into a valley , crossed into another field -- moving faster and faster -- and then climbed up towards a thicket .
The nose dipped further , and the flame suddenly raced along the wings and around the cockpit .
